unnormalised: The Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY) announced a new initiative to digitally link all government-issued IDs, including Aadhaar, PAN, and Voter IDs, by 2025. The move aims to streamline citizen verification processes and reduce redundancy in government databases. Sources within the ministry suggest a phased rollout, starting with linking Aadhaar No. 1234-5678-9012 to PAN ABCDE1234F.
normalised: The Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (M-e-i-t-Y) announced a new initiative to digitally link all government-issued I-Ds, including Aadhaar, P-A-N, and Voter I-Ds, by two thousand and twenty five. The move aims to streamline citizen verification processes and reduce redundancy in government databases. Sources within the ministry suggest a phased rollout, starting with linking Aadhaar number one thousand two hundred and thirty four dash five thousand six hundred and seventy eight dash nine thousand and twelve to P-A-N A-B-C-D-E one thousand two hundred and thirty four F.

unnormalised: However, the announcement has already sparked debate regarding data privacy and potential misuse. Privacy advocates are raising concerns about the centralized storage of sensitive information and the risk of data breaches. They point to previous incidents involving Aadhaar data leaks as reasons for caution, referencing a reported breach on 10/07/2018 where details of over 1 million citizens were compromised.

unnormalised: The government assures that stringent security measures will be implemented to safeguard citizen data. They have proposed a multi-layered security architecture and regular audits to prevent unauthorized access. Further, they emphasize that citizens will have control over their data and can opt-out of linking specific IDs if they choose. A pilot program will be conducted in Karnataka from 01/01/2025 involving 50,000 residents to test the system's security and functionality before a nationwide rollout.

unnormalised: Citizens are urged to verify their details on all their government-issued IDs before the linking process begins. This includes ensuring that names, addresses, and dates of birth match across all documents. Any discrepancies should be rectified by contacting the respective issuing authorities. For Aadhaar, visit the UIDAI website; for PAN, the NSDL website; and for Voter ID, the Election Commission of India website with Voter ID No. XYZ1234567.
